name: Melanoma Iris T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Ciliary body and Iris are both included in the ICD-O-3 site code of C694, but they are staged with different criteria by TNM.  The Schema Discriminator is used to select the schema appropriate for coding extension for melanoma of the iris.  

**Note 2:**  Uveal melanomas arise most commonly in the choroid, less frequently in the ciliary body, and least often in the iris.  Melanomas of the iris tend to be small, and those arising from or extending to the ciliary body typically are large.

**Note 3:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for tumors of the lacrimal gland. Assign TX and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 4:** Iris melanomas originate from, and are predominantly located in, this region of the uvea. If less than one-half of the tumor volume is located within the iris, the tumor may have originated in the ciliary body and consideration should be given to classifying it accordingly.
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a, T1b and T1c. Assign T1only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Not more than 3 clock hours in size

Limited to iris not more than 3 clock hours in size, WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1a
More than 3 clock hours in size

Limited to iris more than 3 clock hours in size, WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1b

Limited to iris WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T1c
Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body, choroid or both

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T2 [NOS]

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T2a
Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body, choroid or both, with scleral extension

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body and/or choroid WITH scleral extension, WITHOUT melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma, or not stated if melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T3 [NOS]

Tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliarybody  and/or choroid WITH scleral extension WITH melanomalytic (secondary) glaucoma

Stated as T3a

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Extrascleral (extraocular) extension, measurement of diameter not specified

Stated as T4 [NOS]
Less than or equal to 5 mm in diameter

Tumor with extrascleral (extraocular) extension less than or equal to 5mm in diameter

Stated as T4a

Tumor with extrascleral (extraocular) extension greater than 5mm in diameter

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4b
